Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 4: Handling and Storage of Hazardous Materials and the Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants 

What are the Responsibilities of Child Care Providers in Preventing Exposure to Toxic Substances?

What are the responsibilities of child care providers in preventing exposure to toxic substances? 

Adhere to Proper Use, Storage, & Disposal

Adhere to proper use, storage, and disposal of toxic substances. 

Avoid 

Take actions to avoid specific toxins.

Follow LARA Regulations

For licensed providers, follow the regulations from Michigan Licensing and Regulatory Affairs. 

Call Poison Center

Call the Poison Center when you need additional information or suspect exposure.  The phone number is 1-800-222-1222.  There are also Poison Center apps for mobile devices.  Smartphones can scan the barcode of a product that was swallowed, determining the specific substance more quickly. 

Since Family and Group Home care is often provided in the same space used by the family, a morning check is recommended to ensure no hazardous materials have been left out and the environment is safe.

In the Support Material section at the end of this chapter, you will find links to Eco-friendly Checklists and fact sheets in English and Spanish for parents and providers on hazardous materials.
